name: Shibnath Pathak
title: Postdoctoral Researcher at UC Davis
summary: Shibnath Pathak received his M.Sc. degree in Physics from Indian Institute of Technology, Madras(India) in June 2009. As part of M.Sc. degree he completed his master thesis on near field scanning microwave microscopy. The developed algorithm is general, so that the single code can produce extended images in the offset, azimuth, reflection angle domains for full 3D subsurface geometries. In addition, the algorithm is designed to produce small volumes (or target oriented regions) of images in semi-real time with out losing the hardware efficiency, with this it is possible to overlap the process of imaging and interpretation, improving the overall processing. The developed codes use OCCA programming approach developed by David Medina and Tim Warburton, a computational kernel written in OCCA can be cross compiled at runtime with multi-threading languages such as CUDA, OpenCL, OpenMP, Pthreads, and Intel COI giving a programmer/scientist to implement a single kernel that can utilize several hardware architectures (GPUs, CPUs) with suitable programming languages.

Raghu has founded several high-technology companies - InfoZen (IT company in 1995), eSeva Inc. (Management Consulting company in 2008), and co-founded WizNucleus (Nuclear Cyber Security company in 2009), Paper Battery (Nanotech Energy Storage company in 2009) and Partners of White Oak (Real Estate Development company in 2010). Before InfoZen, Raghu was a program manager for electronic journals at Reed Technology, where he helped develop several pioneering databases delivered on CD-ROM, electronic journals and encyclopedias. Before joining Reed, Raghu developed industry leading bibliographic information systems for national libraries worldwide including the Library of Congress. Raghu is active in social entrepreneurship and the non-profit sector. He co-founded the Forum for Religious Freedom in 2007 to preserve religious diversity worldwide and has held board positions at the Infinity Foundation, Hindu Jewish Coalition, Arsha Vidya Gurukulam and the Family Services Agency. Raghu has raised several million dollars in support of causes such as tribal children’s education and healthcare in India, preservation of indigenous knowledge traditions and diversity worldwide. Raghu has an M.S. in Computer Science from Virginia Tech, B. Tech in Electrical Engineering from Indian Institute of Technology, Madras and has completed coursework for an M.B.A. in Finance from George Washington University.Specialties:Executive Coaching & Advisory, Corporate Governance, Mergers & Acquisitions, Business Strategy and Mentoring, Homeland Security, Risk & Data Management, Application Service Provider, Government Contracting, Enterprise Portals, Content Management, Search Engines, CRM, Social Enterpreneurship

current_companies.description: BloomReach is a 200-people startup with offices in Mountain View, Bangalore, New York and London. I manage a 20 people engineering team for the Organic Search product which currently accounts for majority of the revenue for the company. I also manage Operations for the company. Working with cloud service providers (e.g AWS) on pricing, feature requests, evaluating new products, etc. Working with customers for best practices in deployment, architecture, security and privacy, etc. Following are some of the projects I have built and/or managed at BloomReach. Crawling (Sitefetch): A web-scale system to crawl data from customer websites including some of the premium Internet Retailers of the world. Data Infrastructure (BloomStore): A Cassandra + SolrCloud based system to manage all of our customer's web content. The input to the system is both crawl and product feeds which are stored in Cassandra tables. Various hadoop based pipelines run on top of the data and enrich it. A subset of the data is then stored as Solr collections to power various search services. This is the content platform for all BloomReach products. Web Analytics: A platform to generate billing data based on a unique attribution model to measure uplift in Organic Search (Visits + Conversions) for our customers. The system processes Pixel logs and combines it with our data to generate stats using Hadoop. Insights for Organic Search: Analyze crawled content from websites. Provide actionable insights, reporting, etc. Canonicalization: System to identify and de-duplicate clusters of URLs which constitute the same page. The system uses a combination of URL based redundancy and content based de-duplication to identify URL clusters. Pages: Customer facing portal to create and edit new content which can be used in various marketing channels. Serving: A cloud-based API to serve data to customer websites through a REST API while adhering to stringent requirements for availability and latency.

title: Sr Process Engineer, Team leader -Litho Quality Control Systems at GLOBALFOUNDRIES
summary: I hope to always stay curious, eager and observe and I hope to retain and learn from what I observe. With what I take back, I hope to bring forth a little more. Science and the scientific and intellectual discussions that are always a part of it, has always been a passion of mine. I spent nearly a decade trying to get a bite of what I considered to be cool and exciting in Materials Science especially in Applied Physics and Materials Characterisation. While retaining the strong academic atmosphere, ventured into F&B in college town Ithaca (NY) where one never really stops from engaging and interacting with intelligent peers and the vibrant community. Having felt that Asia, with huge potential in material resources and an even bigger challenge of efficient usage with the number of people that had to benefit from it, is where I had to be, back I am in Asia exploring my options and looking to learn and contribute. Currently in a Quality Control/Process control role in one of the key, benchmark Entities/Modules for an electronics manufacturing giant in SG where the scale of things and the level of detail that goes into the clockwork is remarkably exciting.

name: Phanisri Pradeep Pratapa
title: Graduate Research Assistant at Georgia Institute of Technology
summary: I am a PhD student in the School of Civil and Environmental Engineering at Georgia Tech. I am currently working on developing computational techniques to study mechanical behavior of materials at atomic scale using ab-initio methods like Density Functional Theory (DFT). Efficient computational techniques can help in applying the ab-initio or atomistic modeling methods on larger systems of atoms which are representative of real systems of interest. My areas of interest are computational mechanics, predictive modeling of materials, iterative methods and high performance computing. In the past, I worked as a Structural Engineer designing offshore oil platforms, did research on structural performance of wind turbines in computationally simulated thunderstorms and developed heuristic rules for optimal design of reinforced concrete water tanks.

title: We are hiring @ThoughtSpot. No recruiters please.
summary: Search: ---------- Despite search advancing quite a lot in the past decade (thanks to Google/Bing), we are still at relatively beginning phases of variety of non keyword based search verticals. My interests/experience here involves with cross language search results, transliteration & translation techniques in search, contextual search based on visual data inputs (photos etc), search in music (compositions, lyrics, notes, patterns w.r.t Carnatic music etc). Automation: --------------- Experience in building mobile infrastructure with special emphasis on testing and automation. Android Ui Automation guru and advocate, essentially conquering the world of android mobile automation. Optimizing to run a piece of software on 10,000+ types of hardware spanning across multiple android OS versions, our client versions, manufacturers, custom ROMs, and last, but not least, different configurations like memory, display density, processing power, network bandwidth, network latency. Android: ----------- With Android and related frameworks development for the past 3 years and being at the forefront in handling new mobile technologies, my particular focus is in scaling mobile platform development end to end. Some of the interesting problems we face when we scale mobile development: - IDE setup and automated upgrades, integration with tests etc. (Ex: Android Studio, Gradle) - code reviews, principles, techniques and gatekeeping methodologies (Ex: gerrit , git) - CI environments: distributed builds, exploring cloud based solutions, running tests on wide variety of real devices. (Ex: Jenkins, mobile device lab), - Regression suites (all those automated unit tests, UI tests, localization passes running smoothly to ensure timely releases) - Releases - Google playstore policies, versioning schemes, alpha, beta programs etc.

name: Noshir Contractor
title: Professor at Northwestern University
summary: Noshir Contractor is the Jane S. & William J. White Professor of Behavioral Sciences in the School of Engineering, School of Communication and the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University, USA. He is the Director of the Science of Networks in Communities (SONIC) Research Group at Northwestern University. He is investigating factors that lead to the formation, maintenance, and dissolution of dynamically linked social and knowledge networks in a wide variety of contexts including communities of practice in business, science and engineering communities, public health networks and virtual worlds. His research program has been funded continuously for over a decade by major grants from the U.S. National Science Foundation with additional funding from the U.S. National Institutes of Health (NIH), U.S. National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA), the Rockefeller Foundation, and the MacArthur Foundation. Professor Contractor has published or presented over 250 research papers dealing with communicating and organizing. His book titled Theories of Communication Networks (co-authored with Professor Peter Monge and published by Oxford University) received the 2003 Book of the Year award from the Organizational Communication Division of the National Communication Association. He is the lead developer of CIKNOW (Cyberinfrastructure for Inquiring Knowledge Networks On the Web), a socio-technical system to enable networks among communities, as well as Blanche, a software environment to simulate the dynamics of social networks.
